The two main forms of ferritin are holo and apo, each with distinct functions. The holo form of ferritin is capable of acting as an efficient and safe factor for iron supplementation. This form of ferritin is composed of a protein shell that encloses a core of iron ions, which are released in a controlled manner to provide the necessary iron for the organism. Studies have shown that holo ferritin can be used to treat iron deficiency anemia in humans, with a study published in the Journal of Nutrition found that holo ferritin supplementation improved iron levels and reduced anemia in patients with iron deficiency.
